Axes Page (3D Graph Properties Dialog Box)

Requires: Full Development System (Windows)

Use this page of the 3D Graph Properties dialog box to specify the appearance of axes on the 3D graph.

This page includes the following components:

  • Axes—Sets the axis you want to configure. Select the axis you want to configure from the list.
  • Caption—Configures the caption for the axis you select from the Axes list.
    • Caption Text—Configures the text of the axis caption to display on the 3D graph.
    • Color—Sets the color of the axis caption. Click this control to display the color picker and select a new color.
    • Font Size—Specifies the font size of the caption for the axis you select from the Axes list.
    • Visible—Displays the axis caption in the 3D graph for the axis you select from the Axes list.
    • Opposite—Displays the axis caption on the opposite side of the Visible axis.
  • Axis Label—Configures the labels for the axis you select from the Axes list.
    • Font Size—Specifies the font size of the label for the axes on the 3D graph.
    • Color—Sets the color of the axis label. Click this control to display the color picker and select a new color.
    • Visible—Displays the axis label in the 3D graph for the axis you select from the Axes list.
    • Opposite—Displays the axis label on the opposite side of the Visible axis.
  • Range—Specifies the minimum and maximum values of the axes on the 3D graph.
    • Autoscale—Adjusts the scale automatically to reflect the data you wire to the 3D graph.
      Note  LabVIEW does not include hidden plots when you autoscale the axes of a graph. If you want to include the hidden plots when you autoscale the axes, make the hidden plots transparent instead. Set Opacity on the Surface tab of the Plots page of this dialog box to 0 to make the hidden plots transparent.
    • Minimum—Minimum value of the scale.
    • Maximum—Maximum value of the scale.
  • Grid—Configures the appearance of the axis grid.
    • Visible—Displays the axis grid in the 3D graph for the axis you select from the Axes list.
    • Color—Sets the color of the axis grid on the 3D graph. Click this control to display the color picker and select a new color.
  • Ticks—Configures the appearance of the major and minor tick marks on the axis you select from the Axes list.
    • Major Ticks—Configures the appearance of the major tick marks on the axis.
      • Visible—Displays the major tick marks on the axis in the 3D graph for the axis you select from the Axes list.
      • Count—Specifies the number of major tick marks that appear on the axis. Count for Major Ticks also determines the number of grid lines and value labels.
    • Minor Ticks—Configures the appearance of the minor tick marks on the axis.
      • Visible—Displays the minor tick marks on the axis in the 3D graph for the axis you select from the Axes list.
      • Count—Specifies the number of minor tick marks on the axis.
    • Color—Sets the color of the tick marks on the axis. Click this control to display the color picker and select a new color.
